headline: KAL’s cartoon

children.data: Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
Ukraine’s fate will determine the West’s authority in the world
The conflict in Ukraine risks inflaming the Sino-American rivalry
How Russia dodges oil sanctions on an industrial scale
’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s

bodyText:
Dig deeper into the subject of this week’s cartoon:
Ukraine’s fate will determine the West’s authority in the world (Feb 2023)
The conflict in Ukraine risks inflaming the Sino-American rivalry (Feb 2023)
How Russia dodges oil sanctions on an industrial scale (Jan 2023)
KAL’s cartoon appears weekly in The Economist. You can see last week’s here.

parts.headline: This week’s covers
parts.description: How we saw the world

parts.headline: This week’s cover
parts.description: How we saw the world

parts.headline: How to win the hot war in Ukraine and the cold war that will follow it
parts.description: After a year of fighting, what comes next?

parts.headline: A year after he promised a transformation, Olaf Scholz has done too little
parts.description: Energy policy has radically altered; defence, much less so

parts.headline: Joe Biden’s new border policies irritate the extremes. Good
parts.description: They mix toughness with generosity and are a step in the right direction

parts.headline: South Africa’s diplomatic descent
parts.description: Cosying up to Russia and China harms South Africa, and the world

parts.headline: China has not resolved its past lending mistakes. But it is learning from them
parts.description: How to speed up debt-relief talks

parts.headline: Letters to the editor
parts.subheadline: On South Korea and Ukraine, ChatGPT, corruption in Britain, Moldova, Bolivia, etymologies
parts.description: A selection of correspondence
